DESCRIPTION.P: This block can realize any type of Scicos block. The function of the block is defined interactively using dialogue boxes and in Scilab language. During simulation, these instructions are interpreted by Scilab; the simulation of diagrams that include these types of blocks is slower. For more information see Scicos reference manual.

ITEM.label: number of inputs
ITEM.SP: : a scalar. Number of regular input ports

ITEM.label: number of outputs
ITEM.SP: : a scalar. Number of regular output ports

ITEM.label: number of input events
ITEM.SP: : a scalar. Number of input event ports

ITEM.label: number of output events
ITEM.SP: : a scalar. Number of output event ports

ITEM.label: System type
ITEM.SP: : a string: c or d (CBB or DBB, other types are not supported).

ITEM.label: System parameter
ITEM.SP: : column vector. Any parameters used in the block can be defined here a column vector.

ITEM.label: initial firing
ITEM.SP: : vector. Size of this vector corresponds to the number of event outputs. The value of the i-th entry specifies the time of the preprogrammed event firing on the i-th output event port. If less than zero, no event is preprogrammed.

ITEM.label: Instructions
ITEM.SP: : other dialogues are opened consecutively where used may input Scilab code associated with the computations needed (block initialization, outputs, continuous and discrete state, output events date, block ending),
